text: - [Ramesh] Hello, my name is Ramesh.

I'm a senior product
manager for Amazon DataZone.
- [Navneet] Hello, my name is Navneet.
I'm a principal specialist at AWS.

Today, we will demonstrate
how Amazon DataZone

empowers data producers
and consumers to discover

and share data at scale across
organizational boundaries
all while maintaining data governance

and access controls using
a healthcare use case.
With Amazon DataZone
you don't have to choose between agility

in getting to the data you
need and data governance

for accessing and sharing
data across your enterprise.
You can get both.

- [Ramesh] As we know,
every enterprise is made up
of multiple teams that own and use data

across a variety of
distributed data stores

across on-premises,
multiple cloud providers
and SaaS providers like Salesforce.

And to do their job,
analysts, data scientists

and engineers need this
scatter data that sets
across these different data sources, owned

by different teams, but do
not have an easy way to access
or even have visibility to the data.
Amazon DataZone fills this gap.

It provides a unified
environment, a zone where everyone
in your organization, from data producers
to data consumers can go to access, share
and consume data in a governed way.
Let's jump into how it works.

- [Navneet] I'm going to
use a very typical scenario
that we see across our customers
in healthcare and life sciences.
In this scenario, a data analyst is trying

to find the right group
of patients for a study

by analyzing clinical data
and past trials information.

In our clinical data
scenario, we have Julia

who is a data engineer
in clinical department

working alongside a team
of engineers and experts.
Julia manages raw patient information

from different sources
and often gets requests

from various teams to get
the right data for analysis.

To share this data more
easily and securely

she wants to catalog and
publish it in Amazon DataZone.
She is our data producer.

- [Ramesh] And Marina
is a seasonal analyst.
She's a clinical trial expert who wants

to use this medical
records and trials data

to identify patients that
fit specific criteria.
She's our data consumer.

Let's see how Amazon
DataZone helps connect them.
- [Navneet] Let's start with Julia

and see how she publishes
data into Amazon DataZone.
She logs into the data zone portal
using her corporate credentials.
She creates a project and environment
which she can use to publish data.
She knows the data sources

that she wants to make
available, so she curates

and creates an automated
ingestion job to connect
to the clinical trial data.

She provides a name and
description for the job

and then selects databases
and specifies the criteria
for what specific table metadata
she wants to pull into the catalog.

She chooses automated
metadata generation option,

check to get machine learning
generated business names
for technical table and column names.
She also sets how frequently she wants
to sync the data from sources.
Within a few minutes, the clinical data

and the trials' metadata,
such as stable names, schema

and other source metadata
will be available
in Amazon DataZone in a draft mode.

Julia will then have the
option to enrich the metadata
and provide rich context to make it easy
for Marina and other data consumers
to discover and understand the data.

She can either accept automatically
generated recommendation
to auto-populate business friendly names.

She can also provide
description, classified terms
and any other useful information
for this particular dataset.

Once Julia has curated
this particular data asset
she publish it to make it available
for data consumers in Amazon DataZone.

- [Ramesh] Now that data
is published and available

in the data catalog, Marina
from the research team

can use Amazon DataZone to
easily locate this data.
She simply logs into Amazon DataZone

and uses the search
panel to search for data.
A list of relevant assets is written

and she learns more about the
data and where it comes from.
She can now filter the result based

on variety of facets such as
glossary terms, data sources
and sort, result based on relevance anti.
Now to perform the patient cohort analysis
Marina knows the data she's after

so she now subscribes to
the data within the context

of the newly created
cohort analysis project.
Once the subscription is approved, any

of our project member
can click on the Athena
or Redshift link and be taken directly

to the corresponding service
console without the need

for additional configuration
or individual permissions.
And finally, Marina

and her team members
are able to query data

from multiple data sources
in a secure environment.
So as you can see the anti-data discovery
and access lifecycle and usage
is happening through DataZone.
You get complete visibility and control
over how the data is being shared,
who is doing so and who authorized it.
Essentially, Amazon DataZone allows you

to give your organization the
freedom they always wanted

with the confidence of the
guide governance around it.

- [Navneet] Amazon DataZone
public APIs will allow
for easy integration across your choice
of data and analytics solution,

while still having the
same level of visibility
and governance across all the data
you want to use for decision making.
Thank you for watching this demo.
